intro: Callista macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stemmed callista, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal regions and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
